Abraham Lincoln to John M. Clayton, 26 March 18491 I take great pleasure in introducing to your acquaintance my good personal and political
               friendBenjamin BondEsq–[Esquire] He is an applicant for the office of Marshall forIllinois; and previous to leavingWashington, I filed his recommendations, with my indorsement upon them to which I refer you– What I there say in his favor, I take great pleasure
               in repeating–

1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter, including the address on the last sheet,
                  which was folded to make an envelope.Lincoln penned this letter while en route toSpringfield, Illinois, having left Washington, DC, on March 20.  He would make his way home via St. Louis
                  by railroad, steamer, and stagecoach, arriving in Springfield on March 31.The Lincoln Log: A Daily Chronology of the Life of Abraham Lincoln, 20 March 1849,http://www.thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1849-03-20;The Lincoln Log: A Daily Chronology of the Life of Abraham Lincoln, 31 March 1849,http://www.thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1849-03-31.

                  Bond’s behalf, though he preferred that the appointment go toCharles G. Thomas.  Bond received the appointment as U.S. marshal and held the job until 1853.Abraham Lincoln to John M.
